item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 1, 2025 at 12:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (93 points | 17 comments)

3. OpenAI O3-Mini (762 points | 710 comments)
4. Bypass DeepSeek censorship by speaking in hex (558 points | 289 comments)

6. Earthstar – A database for private, distributed, offline-first applications (184 points | 24 comments)
7. In Zig, what's a writer? (57 points | 25 comments)

10. Show HN: I made a table comparer to quickly find a new book to read (7 points | 4 comments)
11. Blogging on Paper (12 points | 4 comments)
12. Auto-Differentiating Any LLM Workflow: A Farewell to Manual Prompting (59 points | 10 comments)
13. Elite on the 6502: The original 6502 assembly source, heavily commented (165 points | 35 comments)

22. How to turn off Apple Intelligence (4 points | discuss)
23. Show HN: Uscope, a new Linux debugger written from scratch (220 points | 117 comments)
24. Toward a Sparse Interpretable Audio Codec (8 points | discuss)
25. Scientists find links between Alzheimer's, herpes, and head trauma (134 points | 52 comments)
26. The Severance writer and cast on corporate cults, sci-fi, and more (35 points | 21 comments)
27. Zusie – My Relay Computer (120 points | 31 comments)
28. Better Know a Ruby Thing: Singleton Classes (114 points | 21 comments)
29. Fixing E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial for the Atari 2600 (2013) (118 points | 38 comments)
